Bottle split with mcberko. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with no head. Aroma of wheat, light citrus, grass, funk and hay. Flavour of wheat, hay, funk, orange peel, floral notes and butter . Bright and breezy, crisp and light.

The pour is a slightly cloudy golden body with a thin off white head. The nose has a nice wheat malt and a big spiced yeast. A light grassy hop and a prominent lemon zest note. The taste is wheaty with a nice refreshing citrus and wheat taste. Some nice witbier spice with coriander a standout. Yeast aftertaste with a light tart citrus and spice. The body in medium to full. Overall, a nice witbier.

Pours pale amber with a small head.
Nose shows wheat, citrus peel, hefty coriander, and mint leaves.
Flavours are pretty similar, more doughy wheat, citrus and coriander. Perfectly balanced, no one character really sticks out. Incredibly drinkable.
Could use more carbonation.
Shows that a beer doesnt have to be extremely bitter or malty or alcoholic to stand out.

341ml brown bottle. I poured out half the beer into my glass and to my surprise this beer poured out very clear golden. Upon inspection of the bottle the yeast was compacted at the bottom of the bottle. A quick shake up loosened the yeast and the beer poured out cloudy as intended. Small creamy white cap with light lacing. Typical witbier aromas, lemon stands out a lot. The taste is of wheat, good coriander notes, soft orange notes, a little grassy hoppiness. Yeasty aftertaste with some lingering hop and spice. Fuller in body than other wits Ive had, creamy mouthfeel, moderate carbonation. Well done. DDC are proving to me that they can also excel in lighter styled beers.

From a 341ml bottle on 10/1/0/2011. Pours a cloudy, almost murky yellow colour with a small head. The aroma is primarily spicy and yeasty with the typical banana notes. Flavour wise, theres oodles of lemon, some orange and banana, and an intense spiciness, which has both sour and peppery elements. An excellent, complex and challenging wit.

341mL bottle, pours a cloudy yellow with a tiny white head. Aroma of citrus, banana, clove and wheat. Flavour is quite citrusy, wheaty and florally, with coriander and dandelion notes. Light body, with a heavy floral and citrus finish. Quite nice for the style.

Draft at brewhouse; color was hazy golden with aroma of citrus and spice. I am not usually a Belgium wit fan though I found this quite good. Less coriander and orange peel than some of the Belgium beers (Triple Karmliet). Overall, not a bad beer at all

My Review: hazy yelllow with a white head. Excellent lacing. aroma of citrus, yeast and coriander. flavour is moderately bitter and somewhat sweet. moderate carbonation. minimal to no sediment. Finishes with a taste of indistinguishable spices. Not as Good as Hoegaarden... Perhaps it was the spices? Was good but it costs about $1 per bottle more in Ontario but simply is not as enjoyable. Id recommend trying this one if you like Hoegaarden but would not add it to my regular rotation

Draught at Dieu du Ciel, Montreal. Light yellow, hazy, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty - lightly wheaty and sweetish aroma, citrus and some fruitiness and spiciness (coriander). Body is medium, malty - lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint fruitiness and some spiciness, some citrus. Finish is average, malty - lightly wheaty,  and dryish, sharp spiciness (coriander), some citrus with faint hoppyness.  Dryish and spicy wit.

Refrigerated bottle compliments of pushkinwow, poured into a weizen glass.. Pours hazy golden with small white head that dissapates quickly.  Little lacing, medium/thin body, and coriander aroma.  Taste is acidic zesty citrus, some bready wheat, and a hint of coriander.

Bière blanche de 5.5 % dalcool. Elle possède un goût dagrumes, dorange plus précisément. Elle possède une acidité en finale. Moyen col au versement, elle possède un odorat de fruits/agrumes. Un peu dépice ! La description parle de coriandre, je goûte plutôt le thym.
Pale yellow body with short head. Lemon and coriander notes on the aroma. Orange in the taste along with the coriander, easy drinking.

Hazy golden white with a small dissipating head. Fresh and spicy aromas heavy on coriander, with some doughy bread, lemon zest and chamomile. Coriander and citrus dominate the front palate, opening to vanilla and a soft, malty finish. Full mouthfeel with zesty carbonation. Fantastic example of the style; zesty, spicy and moorish.

Very light. Citrus aroma and taste. Fruity. Pale and fairly hazy appearance, with a minimal white head. 
Light sweetness, with a very light bitter finish. Light body. Very refreshing.

341 ml bottle. Montréal, QC.
Slightly hazy orange golden colour with small to average sized white head. 
Fresh citrus, coriander, yeast and wheat in aroma. Good Witbier could be expected. Wheat, yeast, citrus, coriander, spices and some bitterness (not necessarily from hops) in flavour. Very tasty, refreshing and enjoyable Witbier.

Single bottle purchased from Zyn Liqour in Calgary, AB on 06/24/2011. Colour: Very light yellow with white hints. Low head. Nose: Soap notes, zesty yeast, leafy greens, parsley. Taste: Medium-light sweet, light sour, medium-light bitter. Delicate spice wraps itself around a handful of flowers. Soft walnut and vanilla settle in through the finish - and its quite tasty.

341ml bottle. Pale yellow with a quickly receding white head. Lemon zest, yeast, bit of coriander, odd sweetness (citrus?). Low carbonation, mildly sweet, thin bodied, bit of alcohol, some spice (maybe a bit of clove and coriander) and wheat. Ok but not a favourite from DDC.
Fantastic wit from an always exciting brewer. Strong coriander aroma, a bit oily in the mouth.

12oz Bottle I brought back from Canada. Pours out a cloudy straw topped with a white head. Aroma was lemon zest, spice, and light wheat. Taste was more of the lemon/citrus, sweet wheat, and some spice.

Pale yellow colour, cloudy with a very thick, white head. The aroma is great. Lots of lemony coriander (but not at all soapy) over a bright spicy yeast character. Clove along with a lemon/lime sort of citrus character. There is a nice balance of wheat spice along with some yeast contribution as well. Zippy with a nice yeasty perfuminess. Its a lovely witbier.
very pale pour, modest head. fruity aroma. typical white beer. very smooth and easy to drink.  long pleasant aftertaste.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium white head. A sweet lemon and peppery nose. The flavor is a warm sweet spicy brew; lemons and pepper, smooth but some heat. Nice.

341ml bottle 
5.5% ABV (as written on the bottle) 
I tried this beer on October 27, 2010 at "Smokeless Joes" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a hazy lemonade colour with a thin white bubbly head.  The aroma was wheat, grain, citrus, yeast and some weak spices.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour was wheat and spices with a acidic yeast finish.

Bottle LCBO (Dieu de Ciel promotion) Pours clear straw yellow with medium white head. Aroma of grains and citrus, quite pleasant. Fairly light bodied. Dry, spices more prominent than in aroma. Distinctive but I think I prefer a straight wit.

Brought back from Canadia by my petit frere: Pours a hazy yellow, with a pretty nice white head. Aroma of lemon and spices. Taste has some hop bitterness in there. Lots of lemon. Plenty of spices. Very pleasant mouthfeel, almost creamy in there. Floral notes in there as well. Quite a good witbier methinks.
bottle.  Poured hazy straw coloured with a white head. Citrus wheat aroma. Light mouthfeel, kinda flat. Notes of corriander and some yeast. A blander Belgian Wheat. Some alchol in the finish.

341ml bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with minimal white head that leaves almost no lace. Nose of fresh citrus fruit and spice. Much the same on the palate with the citrus being a little more subdued and I find myself wanting more of a crisp zing than I get.
Has a faint hops aroma, modest head, and an okay yellow-white body. Flavour is a nice lemon and wit blend. Mouthfeel is a bit weak. Its a middle-of-the-pack blanche beer.

Sample at the brewpub. Pours a hazy straw colour with decent white head. Amazing perfumy aroma of slightly tart wheat, some clove, coriander and pepper. Flavours are very clean, tangy wheat, clove banana and very subtle bubblegum. Smooth and well balanced

Bottle. Cloudy straw-yellow appearance. Lively aromas of cardamom, lemon peel, cinnamon, nutmeg and steel jump out of the glass. Spicy, refreshing palate. Slight lemony flavour is overshadowed by cardboard/wood/bark. Bitter wood finish thins out a little too quickly. Good but not great.

Le liquide dévoile une robe blanche passablement laiteuse.  Le nez est complexe et intrigant avec des effluves de vanille, dépices comme la coriandre, de blé comme le bon pain belge, daromates et de fruits comme les agrumes.  Le goût est fidèle aux arômes avec un côté sucré et très légèrement aigrelet, agrémenté dun mélange unique dherbes et dépices.  En bouche, beaucoup de fraîcheur avec une texture veloutée et une effervescence qui me semble parfaite.   La finale est goûteuse et singulière avec des notes de blé et de levure qui saccrochent derrière la langue.
Pretty good beer. Less hazy than a lot of wheat beers, and not much going on in terms of appearance, but delicious flavour with orange and spices. Strongly recommend.
Keg.  Strong tangy orange flavour, overpowering all other flavours for me.  "Sour orange peel beer".

355ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a thin white head.  Aromas of grapefruit, lemon, banana, clove.  Dry in style, with initial dough, followed by lemony citrus, floral notes, and bitter hops in the finish.  Decent stuff, though I wish it had a little more body.

Mildly murky pale yellow with luscious foamy lingering head.  Lovely drink.  Sweet orange and light breadiness to open, moving to a funky yeastiness.  Gentle touch of sweetness lingers throughout.  Multilayered finish lasts forever - sweet, sour, and spice all find a place.
A beautiful wheat beer...citrus off the top with a bit of citrus too. Medium body with some light bubblegum in the finish...smooth with tiny bubbles of light carbonation.
very thin white head, murky urine colour. Very fruity peach I think! Very fizzy sweet fruity taste with a rotten veg aftertaste.

Very hazy yellow pour with a white small bubbled head.  Floral, citrus and spicy sent.  Very distinct taste.  Took a few tries to decide if I liked it or not, and by the end I decided I really liked it.  Not nearly as much citrus as I am used to in a wheat beer.  Surprisingly thick.  I definitely like this but cant see drinking a case of this by the pool over a weekend which is usually what a good Wheat makes me want to do.  Great as a non-session beer though.

Let me start off by saying, i do not like Belgian whites, the style, just does not do it for me. That being said, if I did like Belgian whites, this one would be the one I would drink. The aroma is light, lemon candy, wheat, bread. The flavour is light, smooth, quenching, satisfying, its really well crafted, lemon, orange, spice, and rind in the finish. I dunno, the more i drink this, the more Im enjoying it, i think its slowly converting me over to the white side.

341ml Bottle. Pours cloudy white-yellow with average white head, lacing the glass. Aromas of peppery spice and orange zest above some light bready notes. Coriander comes through in the flavour working well with some hop flavours apparent among a nice bitterness accentuated by the spices. Finish is light, spicy, semi-dry with a lingering bitterness and yeast characteristic. Top wit.
341ml bottle from the LCBO. typical wit aroma, hair salon, a touch spicier then most. solid wit flavour. well done just not my style.

Glad to see LCBO carrying Dieu du Ciel beers, and comes in a single bottle. Pours a cloudy light beige colour with a small white cap (pretty small actually) and gives a bit of lacing. Good tiny bubble carbonation. Witbier yeast aromas with nice coriander. Pretty refreshing mouthfeel that is not too watery. Coriander still present in the taste with some slight bitterness in the finish and mild vanilla coming out in the aftertaste. Not my favorite white beer, but pretty good overall (and nice to see more and more of their brews made available in bottles).

I cannot help but LOL at anyone who reviewed this at sub-4.0.  Seriously.  What are these people thinking?

Ive had this awesome beer on multiple occasions:  First few times were on visits to Montreal, directly at DDC! brewpub, direct from the keg, which undoubtedly is the superior experience.  However in 2010 now, in the late summer season, finally some DDC beers have made their way into Ontario LCBO locations.

Needless to say, being familiar with their beers, I raced out and stocked up on Blanche du Paradis.  It does differ from the fresh draught version in the fact that the bottles actually have a much stronger, harsher astringency and the spice notes especially are WAY more pronounced here in the bottled version.

But that doesnt mean its less enjoyable.  Just different.

On to it.

Super spicy -- the coriander or whatever spices they use is no joke.  Its like a punch in the face.  Background of vanilla, wheat, banana, citrus.  A little over carbonated (just my preference) but does not diminish from the flavor, nor complexity of the beer itself.  Ive disappointedly heard users on forums compare it to other wheat beers or even hefe-weisses but I dont see the similarity at all, personally.  Its very, very spicy, and I suppose takes an experienced beer fan to truely enjoy it.

A++ in my books, have been a fan since day one trying it at DDC! brewpub and am positively thrilled with its arrival (albeit temporarily) in Ontario.

341 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours cloudy, golden in colour with nice large white head. Leaves lots of lacing.  Aroma is citrusy and wheaty.  Big flavour, citrusy and light sweet malt.  Really enjoyable.
Draught, 5% at the brewpub. Distinct teaish coriander aroma. Cloudy yellow colour. Small white head. The flavour also has a lot of coriander. Refreshing. Mild, but cleansing bitterness in the finish.

On tap in a Weizen glass at Dieu du Ciel in Montréal. Beautiful foggy yellow unfiltered beer with a bubbly white head that dissipates slowly. A distinct aroma, sweet and citrusy, and floral spiciness (lavender, coriander, and orange zest) Taste is a crisp and refreshing witbier, a yeasty kick with a thick spicy note (probably from the orange zest) that lingers on the palate seemingly forever. Fantastique...

Bottle:

puts a hazy pale straw ale in the glass with a 1 finger tight cap...modest retention, modest glass lacing quality.

Aroma is biscuity with some light tangerine notes but the coriander predominates.

Nice puckering sandy dry mouth feel.

Flavour has some biscuit notes some herbal hop, a bit of citrus (barely) but again, coriander wipes out the profile...its over powering...nice dry crisp finish but there is so much coriander in here it has an aftertaste like celery and soap.

The key to the witbier style is taming the coriander...making it present but complimentary, not dominant.....Ill take Hoegaarden thanks....this wit is not DDCs strongest offering.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel, served in a tasting glass. Pours cloudy dark golden with a small off-white head. The head slowly fades but leaves a decent amount of fine lace. On the nose, the aroma is yeasty and spicy, with citrus and a hint of clove. The flavour begins moderately sweet and slightly bitter. The sweetness fades a little towards the finish and it acquires slight acidic and sour notes. On the palate, it is light in body with a dry-watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a good wit. It has a nice spicy nose and sweet body. it is relatively light on the clove. 2010-09-04
Aroma of light fruit, and yeat. Flavour is bready, yeasty, with caramel, floural and fruity. Lots of different flavours going on here, not too intense but tasty.

341mL from the LCBO. Thanks for finding out Quebec exists LCBO. Pours a nice hazy whitish yellow with a small white head. Hazy whiteness. Aroma is really solid, bubble gum, powdered sugar, lemony zest, yeasty interestingness, pretty much anything you could want in a Wit. Flavour is light on the palate but quite satisfying by the standards of this style. Nice floral spicy quality that blends well with the dry yeastyness and pale/wheat malts. Elegant. I really appreciate when a brewer pulls off a simple style like this and produces something special, without attempting or adding anything crazy or unneccessary to it (ie. Maple and Juniper). Really nice summer drinker, I may even buy more which blows my mind as I find this style usually not worth a second purchase.

341ml bottle, 5.5% a/v

Beauty of a wheat beer, Nice head, nothing out of the ordinary here. Aroma is bananas cloves, coriander, and some bubblegum. The taste is smooth, bananas, cloves and coriander, just as the smell would allow, also some citrus taste. The palate is smooth and mouthfilling. Overall a basic wheat beer done well.

Bottle from LCBO. Flat off-white head which quickly dissipates Murky wheat yellow with definite citrus and yeast notes. Very light in the mouth, almost watery with a strong coriander and floral hops finish. I am not a huge fan of the style, but this is definitely an interesting example. I am glad I picked up 6

Bottle from the LCBO. Appearance: Rich yellow, lots of cloudiness, small white head. Aroma: Spicy, cloves, orange, cinnamon, a little grapefruit, yeast and cinnamon. Flavour: spicy orange, bitter, lemon rind, lots of wheat & yeast, tangy grapefruit with a long tangy finish. Lovely.

Draught Moose & Mountie Spectapular, Sydney.
Picture perfect witbier with a hazy straw body and tight white foam.
Medium body with good creamy carbonation.
Good intensity on nose and body; orange peel, earthy coriander spice, dried apricot. Very smooth and well balanced beer.
tap at taphouse. very interesting beer. jumps back and forth from sweet to sour. quite heavy on the coriander, with some citrus flavours and a bready malt backing.
Tap. Great taste. Aromas of apple, and coriander. Taste has a sweet start, with sour notes, and a bitter finish. Palate is oily, and medium bodied. Cloudy yellow, with a frothy white head.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity spicy citrus aroma. Fruity yeasty wheat malty spicy citrus flavor with hints of coriander. Has a fruity spicy yeasty wheat malty finish.
Great foamy foggy blonde, beautiful citrus taste and aroma with herbal spiciness. its like fresh lemon peel. Good body, not thin, perfectly satisfying and refreshing.

Bouteille 341 ml. 5%. Arôme dagrumes et de céréales douces. Blonde pâle, brouillée, elle est à la fois pleine de saveurs et douce en bouche.  Rien de trop prononcé, bière bien balancée. Je ne suis pas un amateur de blanche mais cette bière est surprenante.
This beer is sweet, this beer is amazing. This beer is unique, you can taste fruits. The after taste is incredible and the texture is somewhat thick but it is amazing. This beer is worth trying !!

cloudy like i expected it to be. big belgian yeast notes with spices of corriander, tree fruit and some fresh bread notes. big carbonation on the palate some fruity notes again and a somewhat green leaf hoppy finish. it find it is missing a little body on the mid palate but overall another good brew from a great brewery.

hazy, very light coloured yellow. thin white lace and head. Lovely spiced, rich, honey aroma. Awesome flavour of blueberries, summer fruits and juniper berries. great texture. lovely bitter finish.  Really enjoyable and interesting beer.

SOOOOOOOOO REFRESHING!!!!  Nice hazy yellow color, nice rocky foam. nose is spicy with coriander and yeast. flavor is everything a wit should be citrus, orange especially and again spice a little alcohol but not too much really good

Bottle 34,1 cl. Slightly hazy yellow with a rough, off-white head. Aroma of yeast and coriander. Medium body, fruity and citrusy with a rather perfumy spiciness - coriander and lavender - with distinct notes of yeast. Strangely astringent finish. 090110

Bottle 341ml.Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, citrus, moderate yeasty, spicy, coriander. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20100109]

Bottle. Hazy yellow pour with no head. Lots of lemon and orange on this nose, some wheat and a hint of coriander. Taste is past its prime, something half bitter- half sour with some spiciness. Palate has died, little carbonation to liven this one up. It was better.

Fantastic Belgian white.  Maybe the best Ive ever had.  Aroma is orange and yeast.  Pours a hazy yellow with a lingering white head.  Taste is fantastic, orange, coriander and slight acidity and alcohol.  Just another great beer from DDC.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2010 on tap at DDC. very cloudy golden colored with a medium head and lacing. exceptionally citrus aroma, with lots of coriander and clove. taste is smooth with lots of wheat, some more citrus, a bit herbal, grassy, and tart in the end, a nice brew on a hot summer day. one of the best wits ive had.
Light thin nose. Gin and vanilla mango yeast. Full and velvit mouthfeel. Nice head and effervesence.
Bottle at Nya Tröls, MalmöBlond color, pale, but not hazy. The aroma is too light, very light spices, glue. Dry mouthfeel (this is not unpleasant), with a light grassy and hay feeling. Too simple.

12 fl oz bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is citrusy and mild coriander spiced, light phenolic too. Smooth yeasty, wheaty and light citrusy flavoured. Citrusy and lingering spiced flavoured finish.

Bottle at Nya Tröls, Malmö.
Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of spices and citrus with notes of yeast and flowers.
Fruity flavour of citrus, flowers and spices.
Citric and flowery finish.

Bottled sample. Hazy gold in colour with moderate carbonation. Strong herbal aromas of coriander, cooking spices, lemon, orange, and a hint of banana. Fairly wheaty upfront in the mouth, before the citrus and coriander elements take over. The mouthfeel begins fairly thick, but dries out and gets savory (from the spices) rather than bitter. Overall, the spices seem a bit strong for my taste, but its a well made and refreshing wit.

Clear very pale yellow with a dense white head. Aroma is of typical wit components, coriander, light lemon and wheat. Mouthfeel is lively but a bit thin. Flavour is also a bit thin but still with nice notes mentioned above. A solid summer brew.

Bottled at Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm.  Clear golden with some sediment, coarse head. Aroma of buckwheat and coriander. Mid-sweet with clean, slick mouthel and light body. Some juicy orange togther with good amounts of coriander. Low bitterness. Drinkable and tasty enough, but the clean mouthfeel prevents it from being fully refreshing and get that extra kick.

Well made Wit beer that is very drinkable. One can definitely taste the wheat in this beer. The coriander and orange peel flavour is lighter than some may prefer but I find it is balanced very well. A wit with stronger spice may be great for one or two bottles but this is the type of wit that one could drink the whole night.

Draught.  Mondiale 2009 - day 3.  Hazy yellow with an average white head.  Light spice/coriander aroma, with balancing sweet fruit.  The taste is a little less fruity, more grassy - a bit like a very mild trippel.  Thick, spicy and dry mouthfeel, maybe a bit under-carbonated - slightly alcoholic in the finish - only 5%?  hard to believe.  I liked it - refreshing.

Bottle- A hazed yellow with a frothy cap and spotty lace. Aromas of floral hops and clove, cardamon, citrus essence, spices. Sweet curacao and citrus meet yeasty Belgian funk in the mouth, and lead to a floral spice. Creamy, with good balance of acid and sweetness. Food friendly and approachable.

Clear dull yellow with thin but lasting egg-white head and nice lacing. 4/5
AR: Metallic, slightly sweet aroma with loads of coriander. Slightly sour taste, with more coriander and a nice crisp hoppy finish, not too bitter but quite pleasing, and surprising given the style.
Creamy milky body, good carbonation. No complaints I like this, especially the hops. Thanks to Boutip for the trade!
Smells of oranges, perfume and flowers, this beer is incredibly floral.  Has light citrus notes, banana and perfume.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2009 ~ Bottle courtesy of Eric at Big Z Beverage in Huntington, NY. Pours a hazy yellow color with a big white foamy head. A dominant wheat aroma is followed by hints of orange, lemon, and pepper. Taste matches its smell. This Belgian White was refreshing and a pleasure to drink. ~
Hazy orange, thick white head. Distinct aroma, coriander, orange peel. Bright zippy flavor, lemon zest. Quite a well made witbier.
bottle, via trade with glouglouburp, clear golden color with soft foam, nose has a good wheaty spice texture, flavors of banana, orange marmalade, lemon and spice, good lasting finish

Hazy Yellow color. Maily flavor is Orange peel, banana, coriander
Very good beer once again by Dieu du ciel
Pale straw in colour.  Cloudy, nicely carbonated.  Great spicy aftertaste.  Grassy wheaty taste up front.  Great beer.

Blanche du Paradis:  341ml bottle, bought for 2,19$ (BDF, of course), but I saw it at 2,99$ per bottle at some places in the Montreal region: beware.  This white beer is very fruity (orange) and quite cerealish, with rather discreet notes of coriander, some sourness, a delicate hopping and a pretty dry lasting finish.  Enjoyable and very easily drinkable, a good White Beer indeed,  but I like this one a lot less than DDC occasionnal tap Cascade Blanche, which is far more intense in its hop bitterness.

one of the more pleasing beers I have tried. the grains of paridise at a certain zest to a pleasant style. every time I visit Quebec I try to stock up on this beer so that I can slowly enjoy such a fantastic beer.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a thick foamy white head. Very good retention and good lacing. Aroma is coriander, orange peel, grains of paradise, dough and lemon. Flavor is spices (coriander, grains of paradise), fruits (orange peel, lemon) dough and yeast. Medium body and fizzy carbonation.

Bottle courtesy of savvy1982.  Pours a hazy amber with a white head.  Smells of grains of paradise, coriander, ginger, grassy, sweet citrus.  Tastes of crisp wheat, pepper, spice, citrus, velvety mouthfeel.  Excellent!

Bottle from Dépanneur Rahman.  Pours a hazy light yellow with a medium to large clean white head.  Light bubblegum, yeast, touch of citrus.  Medium bodied, tangy, light, and spicy.  Finishes with a light crisp bitterness. Nice wit.

Pours a hazy white/yellow with a rocky, sticky white head. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, spice and citrus... Just like a good wit should be. Coriander, bread, lemon, orange, wheat, and a hint of clove on the nose. Tastes light, crisp and complex. Loads of lemon, coriander, clove, orange peel, ginger, banana, and bready Belgian yeast. Mouth feel is pretty good. This is an excellent Belgian Wit!

341 mL bottle.  Hazy orange-copper with a nice, sticky white head.  Aroma is pleasant, not overwhelming; tangerine, a little spice.  Flavour is, again, pleasant but rather subtle.  A little more spice and less orange than the aroma.  Slightly bitter finish.  Perfect carbonation.  Id love to try this one on tap.

More flavourful and livelier mouthfeel than the styles template, Hoegaaden, but not as good as Blanche de Chambly (to use another Canadian-brewed wit as an example). I picked up a pineapple quality in the aroma and flavour that didnt seem to fit. It gave way to some nice spicy notes in the middle and some orangey, zesty citrus and crisp mouthfeel redeemed it in the end.

Bottle. Pours a lovey hazy yellow, the color of unfiltered lemon juice. Thin put persistent white head with respectable lacing. Aroma is of lemon, coriander, marshmallow, banana, cinnamon, yeast. Palate is creamy and mouthcoating, with notes of lemon rind, oranges, banana, wheat, yeast and coriander. Palate is surprisingly crisp despite feeling rich and mouthcoating. Very good.

Sure I had this on tap at the brewery Bottle in Discovery 12 pack. More hazy than cloudy. Dark yellow. Thin but lasting head. Very nice spice and banana scent makes you want to drink. Very strong coriander flavour. Additional sips bring up the banana with more citrus in the finish and aftertaste. Citrus continues to build. A bit of zest in the mouth feel. Coriander is noticeable in all aspects.

341 bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy yellow gold with moderate white head.  Aroma of spices, citrus and wheat.  Lasting lemon flavour with spices towards end.  Not a favourite style of mine generally but this is a fairly impressive beer.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2012 On draft at the Dieu du Ciel! Brewpub. Pours excellent body - hazy bright orange with nice head. Aroma is great as well, fruit, coriander, orange. The taste is very flavorful. One of the most flavorful wits Ive ever had.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2009 341ml bottle. Pours hazy yellow-golden. Good sized white head. quite foamy and good retention. Laces on the glass. Aroma is spicy and citrusy. Fruity hints of orange as well. Enjoyable aroma. Wheat flavour. Some acidity and a bit alcohol on the finish. Quite dry on the finish. Quite enjoyable and well balanced. Rating #35

Acheté à la trappe à fromage et dégusté dans un verre de blanche de chambly. Apparence or clair ambré avec une belle mousse et une bonne effervescence. Arômes de coriande, de pelure dorange et de pain. Un goût de blé, de lime avec une bonne amertume et une touche de saveur aigre de pamplemousse.

Bouteille de 341 ml. Dégusté avec french tickler. Bière de couleur Or brumeux avec un moyen collet très collant. Odeur de citron, pamplemousse, sel et pommettes. Gout de blé, citron, rhubarbe, clou de girofle et un  semblant de vin blanc.

Bottle: Poured a hazy yellow color ale with some white haze and a big foamy head with good retention and great lacing. Aroma of coriander and loads of wheat are the main point here. Taste is a mix between some orange peel, some coriander and nice bubblegum wheat malt. Loads of character for the style with a full body and great carbonation. Very well done and it would be nice if the beer was offered outside of their mix pack.

Bouteille de 341 ml. Arômes de céréales et de citron. Robe blonde et trouble, très belle mousse qui tient bien. La coriandre et les agrumes sont bien présents en bouche et s’appuient sur une belle présence de céréales. Légère acidité de blé en finale. Une excellente Wit qui se démarque par son équilibre.

Le gout de ble est particulierement present et plaisant. Corriande et agrumes viennent agrementer le tout.

Wheat flavours are there and are pleasant. Corriander and citrus embellish very well this wit.
bouteille de 341ml, bière de belle couleur blonde, fine bulle, juste assez trouble, activité co2 importante, nez de blé, bouche soyeuse, un brin piquante, agrume et coriandre. très bonne

on tap, DDC.  Color is pale gold, with a large head.  Aroma of what, yeast, sugar and some soft fruit.  Flavor is a touch spicy, with wheat, orange, and spice.  I enjoyed this, though the flavors do not come together in a particularly memorable way.

Bouteille de 341mL, achetée au Dep de la Rive, toujours agréablement surpris de boire une Dieu du Ciel! toujours un présage de délice avant même d’ouvrir la bouteille, mon sens fût bon, bière délicieuse, couleur et voile parfait, une autre n’importe quand !

Bottle - a soft and subtle wit, with everything in its right place, in the right proportion - too many wits overpower with one quality, but this has a creamy palate, and the flavors move across the tongue in harmony - the mellow spices and orange peel lend themselves well to the light, crisp hops in the background, and the light sweetness at the end compliments the floral notes that develop - an excellent wit.
Mmmm super de bonne blanche!  Gout velouté, bonne mousse, aucun arrière-goût. Très douce. Encore bravo pour Dieu du Ciel!

On tap. Blanches are difficult not to like, specially on a warm summer night. But you can erally feel this is a quality blanche. A nice mix of citrus, malt and other agrumes to give us a nicely balanced blanche. I would have drank this all night long. A really good blanche.

Bottle 

App.: 
Cloudy golden poor, white head with a little lacing

Aromas: 
Wheat, orange zest, pepper, grassy notes, coriander

Palate:
zesty, nicely carbonated, tangy, nice peppery bitterness


Flavors: 
Citrus notes, coriander, pepper, hint of orange and lemon zest


Notes: Very respectable witbier... nice balanced mouthfeel

[1415-20080530] Tap. Light wit wheat aroma has hints of lemon zest and grass. Hazy, light yellow white body with a medium-lasting creamy white head. More wheatie grass in the flavour. Light body. Refreshing.
(@ Dieu du Ciel!; Montreal, QC)

Le goût évolue en bouche à chaque gorgée. On passe ainsi d’un puissant goût d’agrûmes et coriandre à, progressivement, un goût de blé voir même, comme l’étiquette le suggère à un goût de pain en bouche.

Cette blanche vient détrôner toutes les blanches du type au Québec et s’installe en reine. Cheval Blanc et la Blanche de Chambly peuvent aller se rhabiller.

C’est une bière trouble ravissante raffraîchissante qui plaira a bien des palets.

Elle est disponible en caisse de douze en 
paquet mixte de Dieu du Ciel et on en compte 4 dans chaque caisse. Ce paquet risque fort de détrôner le paquet dégustation des "bières douces" de Unibroue avec des bières beaucoup plus savoureuses.

On tap at Dieu Du Ciel. Hazy peach pour with minimal white head. Aroma is loaded with peach and nectar- sweet and poweful. Flavors are again dominated by sweet nectar with some citrus zest and hop presence. Spice is prevalent as well. Palate is almost sticky, subsiding into a somewhat dry finish. One of the best of the style.

on tap at brewpub. Pours Hazy light yellow with small head. Aroma is massive peach with yeast and spice. Flavor stays with aroma, huge peach and nectarine notes. Phenomenal for a sweet beer. Decent sticky palate, awesome brew.
aroma of citrus, and wheat withs ome yeasty notes. Flavour is clean and crisp, with a tad bit of funk. nice finish of citrus, and a tad bit of sour. Nice wit!
Tap at DdC. Spicy clove nose with lots of grains of paradise. Nice, sherbert and unmalted wheat flavor with a good spiciness.  There is an abundance of sweet orange which is delightful.

Draught (6 oz. sample) at Dieu du Ciel! Slightly hazy golden with a small head. Nice spicy nose with notes of lemon and tropical fruit and a faint hint of yeast. Crisp body. Refreshing flavour of citrus and pineapple, and hints of coriander and yeast in the finish. A nice wit indeed.
Hazy straw colour with minimal head.  Aroma is apricot, lemon and wheat.  Fresh and citric with a flatter palate and nice spice on the finish.  Tasty.

Smallish white head. Hazy yellow body with light carbonation. Citric, spicy mealy aroma. Dryish acidic spicy coriander taste, kind of mealy. Dry, spicy coriander aftertaste. Nice, balanced, not their best. (0.275l draft.)

On tap at the brewpub, visited June 23 2007 with a big group of friends (no fellow rateberrieans though). Murky lemony straw colour with a big merangue of a head. Fresh fruity aroma of citrus and pears immediately apparent, then softer wheatiness and sweet spices become more evident as your nose sinks into the pint. Zesty light mouthfeel with all of the flavours that the aroma promised. A terrific example of the style.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: [on tap at Dieu du Ciel!] Amazing perfumy aroma of slightly tart wheat, some clove, coriander and pepper. Perfectly poured-- hazy straw color, with a nice white head. Flavors are very clean, tangy wheat, clove banana and very subtle bubblegum. Smooth and well balanced, one of the best belgian witbiers Ive had.

Cloudy & pale, not much head for a belgian. Aroma of fresh fruits and cloves.  Very mild flavor with notes of pear, apple and cloves. Lightly hopped (noble ???).  Overall, smooth with tangy mouthfeel.  Prefer the doubels and tripels but exceptional still.
Hazy white color, not much head. Nose of coriander, citrus and cantaloup. refreshing.

Draught, at the pub on August 14 2006; eye: straw with yellowish reflections and a whitish hue, nice white head made up of small and large bubbles, lacing no effervescence; nose: my nostrils are full of coriander, citrusy, freshness, wheat; mouth: citrus fruits, caramel, rather thin, almost fizzy or is it the coriander playing tricks?, finale in coriander, medium body, oily texture, no bitterness, lightly sweet

FRANÇAIS

Fût, bue sur place; oeil : paille avec des reflets jaunâtres et une teinte blanchâtre, belle mousse blanche blanche formée de grosses et petites bulles, dentelle, pas deffervescence; nez : coriandre à pleines narines, citrique, frais, froment; bouche : agrumes, caramel, plutôt mince, presque pétillante ou est-ce la coriandre?, finale en coriandre, corps moyen, texture huileuse, pas damertume, légèrement sucrée

Draught at the brewpub. Pours a hazy yellow with an average size lasting creamy white head. Great wheaty aroma, nice and spicy, just how I like it. Flavours just as good: wheat, yeast, some fruit and lots of spices -- very tasty on such a hot day. Nice medium body. This is one of the best Wheat beers Ive had, I loved it.

On tap at the brewpub.  Exactly what I was looking for after hiking around the mountain all day.  Hazy dark yellow, murky.  Thick creamy white head.  Lovely strong coriander aroma and lots of wheat.  Good taste - lots of wheat, lots of coriander, but little else and a little watery.  Simple, sweet, very quenching and well made.
Hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma was soapy oranges with some clove. The taste was lemoons. with a bit of clove. There was also some spice in the finish. This finished with a little soap.

Cloudy yellow body with a thick long lasting white head.  Very strong citrus nose, even by witbier standards.  Yeasty, citrus/lemon, banana.  I didnt notice the spices that other reviewers have.  Simple but well done, a slightly above average witbier.  Heavens White might be pushing it a bit, Purgatorys White maybe  Draft at brewpub, full pint.
Jaune blanche voilé, petit collet qui dure. Arome dagrume assé présant. Goût de lime/citron et de blé. Très bon pour lété.
A hazy light yellow beer with a nice white head. Both the aroma and flavor are very wheaty with a strong presence of lemon.
Draught at the brewpubHazy yellow, a bit musky and medium body. A bit of lime and yeast. Lemon and more dry citrus notes. Another QBYS.

cloudy straw colored with a medium head.  Very citrusy aroma, with lots of coriander, lemon, some orange peel, and some clove.  Flavor is smooth with lots of wheat malt, some more citrus, a bit herbal, grassy, and tart in the end, but still pretty smooth.
Thin clear with slow moving bubbles. Soapy scum head. Honey grass wheat and clover. Troasted white bread. Dry apple and pear. Grain and slight grit in the lightly acidic finish.

hazy yellow, white head.  aroma of coriander, yeast, citrus and pepper.  light spritzy mouthfeel.  tart citrus lemony flavours with biscuity and wheaty malt.  a soft and nicely balanced witbier.  well done.

draft during RBSG visit - pale yellow with a lot of citrus, pepper, and yeast in the nose.  sweet sweet flavor, mostly pineapple and grapefruit plus generous amounts of corriander and pepper.  smooth and crisp, very easy to drink session beer.

07.11.05  Tap at brewpub.  Hazy yellow gold.  Sturdy white foam.  Lots of citrus and heaps of corriander.  Not so yeasty other than some solid acidic bite.  Not my favorite DDC, laid back, weak bodied, and a bit plain.

Pint at the brewpub, RBSG Montreal.  Hazy gold with a lasting small white cap...sweet, spicy lemon-orange nose, lots of bakery goodness here with coriander, orangepeel and light honey, very fresh...light, refreshing and well-balanced body with sour lemons and apples nicely juxtaposed against honey and sweet malt...quite nice Wit.
(RBSG05) Hazy golden body topped by off-white head.  Aoma is medium sweet, honey, herbal, some pepper.  Taste is medium sweet, herbal, honey, light pepper.  Light-medium body.  A pleasant Wit.

RBSG 2005. Very pale pastel yellow, moderate white head. Yeasty aroma highlighted by lemon, mild orange, and muted spice. Flavour is delicate, muted pepper and spice, with ephemeral notes of candied lemon peel. Smooth but average palate. An interesting wit.
Pour was cloudy bright yellow with a thin white head...smell is butter?, bacon?, cloves and corriander...a little thin, but nice rounded banana and spice sweetness...

RBSG 2005 at DDC: Poured cloudy lemon yellow with a big pillowy white head. Nice aroma of yeast and lemon, light banana and coriander. Lightly carbonated with all the great taste of a good wit. Mild sweetness in the finish. Very nice.

2005 RBSG Montreal Saturday. Hazy yellow colour with a creamy and fizzy white head. Big coriander, citrus, and orange peel aroma. Coriander, citrus, curacao, and ginger flavours. Nicely spiced. Light bodied, a touch fizzy, but dry and refreshing.

RBSG 2005... Poured a hazy yellow color with a small, white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of sweet citrus, spices and light yeast.  Taste was full of spices, tart citrus, and finishing dry and yeasty.
spicy finish.  big wheat taste.  this is an outstanding belgian white.  very cloudy and flavourful.

yellow hay color, with a long white head, wheat, citrus fruits of lemon and grapefruit, pale malt aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with zesty citrus fruits, even hint of pineapple, wheat, touch of acidity in a lactic lemony finish with good carbonation.

Pours a very hazy yellow color with a thin fluffy white head that leaves beautifull lacing on the glass. Appealing aroma of yeast, citrus and spices. Very citric flavor of yeast, citrus, spices and wheat. The body is medium, the texture creamy and the carbonation moderate.

Verre de dégustation à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur dagrûmes, de banane et de coriandre. Apparence: Couleur paille blanchâtre voilée. Moyen col mousseux. Faible densité des bulles. Large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût deau minérale au citron et de gingembre. Court arrière goût. Palette: Corps mince et texture aqueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût de citron. (Rating #153)

On draught at the brewpub, 4/16/05 with MartinT, beerbuzzmontreal and his friend.  Strong pencil-yellow-toned, gold-tinged body, hazy, with a medium-sized white colored head, fair retention and good lacing.  The darker than usual yellow color of the body, looking back, was a good indicator that this wasnt going to be just a light, wimpy, simple wit; not that one would expect that from this brewery.  Aroma of a well homogenized curacao, sweet orange, vanilla and yeast.  And of course, dont forget the coriander.  Flavor begins with tangerine purée, light lemons and tart wheat.  Belgian yeast abounds as the coriander begins to assert its dryness.  But in good balance and with good timing, comes some lightly sweet malt.  Honey and almonds set things to a perfect balance.  If my ratings of McNeills talk about a fantastic mouthfeel, unique to the brewery, then I believe my notes about Dieu du Ciel beers should talk about a stupendous and predictable balance of flavors, which I think they do.  This one is no different.  The malt, spicing and yeast are all present in perfect amounts.  Very solid medium body is both quenching and fulfilling.  Smooth, creamy mouthfeel is slightly broken up by lightly pepper carbonation.  Tingling tartness of wheat and tangerines finish the beer with light bubblegum lingering.  Uncompromising tartness and a body much larger than usual, assert that this is not your grandmothers wit.

Aroma:wheat beer and ginger...
Appearance:hazy gold,good head...
Flavor:Spicy,wheat,sweet,ginger....
Hazy blonde with banana aroma with light lemons. Banana notesin taste with cloves and honey. Rich bodied, round in mouth.
Small white head with yellow cloudy body. Herbs, grapefruit and orange are dominant as well as banana and coriander. This all makes a nicely complex aroma which is not often found in a white beer.
Soft banana, light note of vanilla with soft citric feel. Bright scent, gold, hazy wheat. Medium light body, drinkable but this wit is just slightly above of average.
Refreshing crisp wheat beer. Modest fruit in taste though bubblegum fruit aroma. Too carbonated fizzy. Light texture. Bit of lemon and corriander

Beautiful cloudy pale yellow with a long-lasting white head, 1inch thick and greatly laced. Meringous alike. Great witbier aroma, bursting of coriander, a bit of lemon, lime zest, fresh wheat. Superbly executed witbier once again, nicely balanced and undoubtedly a style well mastered by JF Gravel, spicy (cloves, coriander) and fresh while being elegant and displaying a refreshing while creamy mouthfeel.

Yellow cloudy body with some greenish (!!) glints. White diminishing creamy head. Very pleasant fruity nose (citrus, grapefruit, banana) that carries some hints of coriander. In the mouth, the combined effect of fruitiness and carbonation is particularly refreshing. Honest bittersweet final. Nice Witbier!

Aroma is sweet, with lots of fruits, and BIG TIME BUBBLE GUM.  Slightly hazy light blondish color  with quickly dissipating white head.  Aroma also sort of smells like commercial cleanser.  Very SOUR brew with hints of bitterness in the middle.  Too sour for my tastes...

On tap at brewpub...straw colored pour with medium white head that dissipated fast.  Aroma of banana and clove with some citrus.  Smooth mild flavor, with very light spiciness.  I sampled this after the Rigor Mortis and the Rigor Mortis Double so that may explain the mildness that I describe here.  Very clean, very drinkable, very smooth.
Beautiful clean witbier with lemony/lime undertones.  Highly carbonated and lightly spicy. An excellent wit.

Citrusy, spicy aroma. Pale, opaque, straw coloured with fizzy white head that recedes to ring. Nice spiciness in the initial flavour with good malt base and lasting sweet lemon flavour. Carbonation is good and body is light and refreshing. This is adult-style lemonade. On tap at the brewpub.

wit style beer has an interesting sweet malty lemon nose with hints of soap.  The body starts tasting like a fireplace then a very big gingery taste comes along with taints of bubblegum and soap.  The finish is mildly astringent and earthy. A very fascinating beer. It was probably my favourite of the beers I tried there.

Cloudy straw (almost white). White foam. Yeasty (banana), spicy (pepper) aroma w/ notes of orange rind & coriander. Light, effervescent feel. Yeastiness subsides somewhat in flavour & spices comes through in abundance. Some unmalted wheat as well. Finish leaves the tongue slightly numb.
Cloudy yellow in colour.  Aroma was of bananas and citrus, sour.  Flavour is sweet, citrusy, slightly creamy.  Finishes slightly spicy, crisp and dry.
Pours a cloudy golden with a thick white lacey head and light citrus and spice aroma.  Body is thin with a touch of malt and coriander.  Finishes light and crisp, a decent wit.
strong spicey nose, real good zest.   extremely cloudy with a pale yellow color.   slightly sweet, very citrusy and spicey.  dry finish.   i like
(Draught) Straw body. Hoppy with lemons. Complex lemon and hops concoction. Dry finish. Good?

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2003 (re-rate) Hazy yellow, not much head.  Still a fresh coriander aroma mixed with lemony notes but with an annoying hint of sulfur.  The flavor was of lemon and yeast, nice mouthfeel.  (Original 08/02)This refreshing beer is full of lemon and coriander with a nice "wheat feel".

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2008 A plethora of banana bread flavors and ginger in a rich wheaty body...Great orangey fruitiness and vivacious coriander seeds...There is abundance in paradise...This one is as excellent on tap as it is from the bottle...
Not bad.  Authentic Belgian whit flavour.
UPDATED: SEP 1, 2014 Light gold, rather bright for a wit, malt-accented, clean pale and maybe a bit doughy.  Spices - mostly coriander - are understated.  Decent, maybe a bit shy.
